titleStmt.title: The jovial companions, or, the three merry travellors [sic], who paid their shot where ever they came without ever a stiver of money. To an excellent north-country-tune.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for C. Bates, at the Sun and Bible in Pye-Corner,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "There was three travellers, travellers three ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
